statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: MD Baltimore Co 78, Binghamton 74
article.story: CATONSVILLE, Md. (AP) -- John Zito scored 19 points, Brian Hodges added 17 and Maryland-Baltimore County beat Binghamton 78-74 on Thursday night, snapping the Bearcats' four-game road winning streak. Jerrell Dinkins had 15 points and nine rebounds and Mike Housman added 10 points for the Retrievers (8-12, 4-5 America East), who had lost two straight and five of six. Andre Heard led Binghamton (7-13, 3-6) with 21 points. Mike Gordon scored 11 and Duane James 10 for the Bearcats, who have lost two straight after a six-game winning streak. UMBC took advantage of two long droughts by Binghamton, which started the second half 1-for-11 from the field and went 6:39 without a field goal after Heard's basket off a turnover got the tied the game at 62 with 7:47 left in the second half. Ian Milne hit a free throw for a 63-62 Binghamton lead with 7:13 to go, but Zito's three-point play jumpstarted a 9-2 run that put UMBC ahead for good. Zito fought through a double team to score and Hodges hit a jumper, making it 67-63. After Heard hit two free throws, Chris Pugh knocked down a foul-lane jumper and Hodges followed with a driving bank shot as the Retrievers went up 71-65. Zito had 14 first-half points, but Gordan hit a jumper with 3.5 seconds left in the opening half for a 43-all tie at intermission. The Retrievers got eight points from Zito in a 11-2 run for an early 20-12 lead. Binghamton chipped away at the deficit, knotting the game at 29 on a three-point play by Sebastian Hermenier with 5:44 remaining.
